trans-unit.source: When CARDNAME enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
trans-unit.target: When CARDNAME enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.

trans-unit.source: "Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch."\n—Naimah, Femeref philosopher
trans-unit.target: "Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch."\n—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

trans-unit.resname: PAL02·3 | Arc Lightning | Card Text | Paragraph 1
trans-unit.source: CARDNAME deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three targets.
trans-unit.target: CARDNAME deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three targets.

trans-unit.source: "It is vain to look for a defense against lightning."\n—Publius Syrus, Maxim 835, trans. Lyman
trans-unit.target: "It is vain to look for a defense against lightning."\n—Publius Syrus, Maxim 835, trans. Lyman

trans-unit.resname: PAL02·4 | Dauthi Slayer | Card Text | Paragraph 1
trans-unit.source: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
trans-unit.target: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

trans-unit.resname: PAL02·4 | Dauthi Slayer | Card Text | Paragraph 2
trans-unit.source: CARDNAME attacks each combat if able.
trans-unit.target: CARDNAME attacks each combat if able.

trans-unit.source: "A wisp of life remains in the undergloom of Death: a visible form, though no heart beats within it."\n—Homer, *The Iliad*, trans. Fitzgerald
trans-unit.target: "A wisp of life remains in the undergloom of Death: a visible form, though no heart beats within it."\n—Homer, *The Iliad*, trans. Fitzgerald

trans-unit.resname: PAL02·5 | Mana Leak | Card Text | Paragraph 1
trans-unit.source: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
trans-unit.target: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.

trans-unit.source: "If a man will begin with certainties, he shall end in doubts."\n—Sir Francis Bacon,\n*The Advancement of Learning*
trans-unit.target: "If a man will begin with certainties, he shall end in doubts."\n—Sir Francis Bacon,\n*The Advancement of Learning*
